TopicTitle: [1.12.x] Tundra Exploration - v7.0 (Nov 5th, 2023) - (Re)Stockalike SpaceX Falcon 9, (Crew) Dragon (XL) & Haven-1!

Articles.Content: Hmm, it says I got 1.2.2, but maybe the update didn't work for me: the solar panels on my Dragon 2 cargo trunk are still blue, not black. Also, I can't find a Falcon 9 1.0

12 hours ago, infinite_monkey said:

Hmm, it says I got 1.2.2, but maybe the update didn't work for me: the solar panels on my Dragon 2 cargo trunk are still blue, not black. Also, I can't find a Falcon 9 1.0 

This will be in the next update.

8 hours ago, KBR said:

Really nice Mod, thank you for the great work.

The earliest Version even works with the Tweakscale Mod. Have i missed something in the changelog? Thats great!

I always had some issues with the very wobbly tail fin the Starship stands on. But now, when i scale the hole starship 150% up to a 7.5m diameter, theres no wobbling at all.

Just for everyone who had the same problem

 

Yep, I fixed the joints on the legs. I fixed it before but I noticed I never put the fix in the .zip.

I was curious if (when you're done with the stuff that you currently have on the roadmap) you'd be able to add different texture options which add the SpaceX and falcon 9 decals to the tanks and Dragons? Or maybe do an optional addon which puts them in? I personally think the decals are a huge part of the look of Falcon 9, so it would be cool to see them in the mod.

I agree with the post above. 

Also, the falcon 9 has this unrealistic feeling in the main fuel tank's textures. Would love if you make it a bit more realistic looking like it's real life counterpart.

15 minutes ago, Natokerbal said:

Be aware this mod is designed to be stockalike not a perfect replica if you want that go install launchers pack.

But what is stockalike these days? Prior to 1.4 and Making History. This fitted perfectly into the stock parts. Now, barely anything that was used to be "stockalike" doesn't fit anymore. Squad really has gone for a more modern and whiter look. I am not sure if I should take that direction as well. Probably not any time soon. Like @Stone Blue told me the other day, KSP is changing. (Not really the direction I wanted it to go) but oh well.

And yeah for a way more realistic look I highly recommend the Launcher Pack by @Kartoffelkuchen. Those models are really nice and give you a real looking Falcon 9!

9 hours ago, damonvv said:

I made a stockalike version for the Falcon 9. Not my intention to make it look like the real life thing.

 

But what is stockalike these days? Prior to 1.4 and Making History. This fitted perfectly into the stock parts. Now, barely anything that was used to be "stockalike" doesn't fit anymore. Squad really has gone for a more modern and whiter look. I am not sure if I should take that direction as well. Probably not any time soon. Like @Stone Blue told me the other day, KSP is changing. (Not really the direction I wanted it to go) but oh well.

And yeah for a way more realistic look I highly recommend the Launcher Pack by @Kartoffelkuchen. Those models are really nice and give you a real looking Falcon 9!

There's one thing about KK's launcher pack -

Although it is extremely similar in look to the actual Falcon 9, it is really not well optimized for flight.

What do I mean by that? Well, you see, an example is the "vernor" thrusters on KK's falcon 9. They work on monopropellant.

You ask me, what's wrong with that?

Well.. The fuel tank in the center has barely 60 monopropellant inside of it. Nowhere near enough to land, I've tried it several times, always ended up running out of monopropellant.

Second, the gridfins.

On Tundra Exploration the Gridfins themselves turn slightly to change the course of the falcon 9.

In KK's launchers pack.. No.. It doesn't turn. They use the exact same mechanisms from the stock aerobrakes in KSP, which are pretty different to gridfins.

And then you have the dragon.

There's no functional dragon in KK's launchers pack, while in Tundra Exploration.. Well, you have a really good functioning cargo AND crew dragon, and I care a lot about this part because I love to launch resupply dragons to my orbital space station and berth them. This can't be done in KK's launchers pack, meaning, the falcon 9 is pretty much a satellite launcher.

Also, I would really love it if Tundra Exploration follows Squad's path for a more modern look.

They simply look amazing to one's eye.

Well, atleast, my eye.

 

 

Nontheless, an amazing mod this is. Thank you for bringing it back to life!

Edit: Also, KK's launcher's pack seems abandoned to me. KK has not been responding to replies and hasn't been doing anything, it's only a matter of time until a KSP update breaks the entire thing.

Edited January 6, 2019 by Waseemq1235

4

I think this has really brought Restock to the fore. The change in artstyle with the new parts means the rocketry parts are even more different to the Porkjet parts
@damonvv can you make a crew access arm/tower, when they finish the real thing?

1 hour ago, TheRedTom said:

The change in artstyle with the new parts means the rocketry parts are even more different to the Porkjet parts

Wait...What???...

you say ..."even more different to the Porkjet parts" ...

Do you mean "more like" the Porkjet Parts?
Because they *ARE/WILL BE* more like the Porkjet Parts... I'm pretty sure the team is pretty heavily refering to the Porkjet-styled aircraft/spaceplane parts for inspiration/comparison.

Quoted from Restock OP: 

Create a unity of design and style for all parts: In order to minimize work we'll be targeting the revised aircraft parts, which are the largest consistent block of parts.


Now, will they look *exactly* like the PJ-styled parts?... maybe not, but probably pretty close... and for the parts that are NOT part of what PJ designed, I think the Restock parts will be very "Pork-alike"

Also, Restock is not "just" about redoing the art style... thats what *users* mainly see and focus on...
But there are more improvements to the parts *behind the scenes* that will be done, which most people wont be seeing with their *eyes*... but they will have improved effects on/during gameplay that people might be able to detect... 

 Preserve the general aesthetic of KSP: We will do our best to keep the stylings of the more iconic parts while updating quality and fidelity.
Create consistency in detail level: no more 4k textures for minuscule pieces!
Minimize performance impact: use atlasing and efficient texturing to limit the need for any kind of better hardware than base KSP.

 

Edited January 6, 2019 by Stone Blue
I think @damonvv should do the textures more inline with Nertea and etc's artstyle, like in Restock.
